ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: such a great class, super interesting material

I gained a lot of knowledge about the supernatural and its interpretations, specifically in the modern, western world. We read many influential texts such as the bible, Summa Theologica, and Malleus Maleficarum, analysing them through the lens of what it displays about the supernatural. The class also involved a reading summary and presentation which makes you deal with information critically.
I learned about magic, miracles, and apparitions in Christendom.
This was my first religious study class and I loved it! I learned a ton!

One of the takeaways from class was thinking about historical beliefs in the supernatural as something that was practical and rooted in the experiences and context of the people who held them, making sure that when doing historical studies of religion to not be dismissive of previous beliefs and to consider them as real and valuable to the people who held them, regardless of what contemporary assessments of the supernatural are.
Insight into the history of the supernatural
Religious studies and history of religious studies, relevant figures and belief systems
I learned about the supernatural and people's relationships with it over time.
In this class, I wrote my longest paper ever. Professor Eire and Dominique helped me to craft my argument and find sources

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Less discussion of the history of magic and occultism than I would have hoped. Lectures often felt like a normal history class summarizing the history of Christianity.

This course was one of the best I've taken at Yale. The texts very so well selected and so much extra material was provided for each week for free. I liked the format of lecture for next week's readings and then discussion for the current's splitting the class. I would've liked more engagement with Professor Eire as he didn't teach my section, but he made an effort to see everyone.
It would be nice to explore the supernatural in America, specifically Native American life.
No notes. Professor Eire is an incredible professor and person.

A strength of the course was that it was structured around primary readings which allowed for a depth in historical studies and the development of close reading skills of primary texts. The course was well structured and by having lectures that prepared one for the readings it made conversations have more depth to them.

Very interesting content, great lecturers. The lectures can be improved and perhaps shortened. Discussion sections should have starting themes to shape and guide the conversation. Suggest assigning more work and reducing the reading workload.

Strengths: split course between lecture and discussion, interesting, unique topic
Weaknesses: might be easier to follow if lectures that day were on same content as discussions/readings
I loved this class and wouldn't change anything about it. Professor Eire is an amazing lecturer.
I loved the course and had a great expereince

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: definitely

Take this course if you can. I am a STEM student, but the lectures before all of the readings make everything very accessible, and I learned a massive amount. The content in the course should genuinely be interesting for just about anyone (levitations, vampires, etc.), and both the lectures and discussions are fun. Professor Eire is one of the best professors I have had here at Yale, and you would do yourself a favor by taking any class with him, but especially this one.
Yes, the supernatural is an interesting subject and deserves a presence in academia.
Absolutely, regardless of major this class is so engaging and fascinating. Professor Eire is an amazing instructor and expert on the topic you won't find elsewhere.
Yes! It's great to learn about the supernatural to expand your knowledge of the human experience.
100%. It was amazing.

Yes! The course was incredibly interesting and engaging. It also discussed elements of religious belief that are not always as closely examined and provided a fuller picture of historical belief systems.

Depends, it's a good introduction to a "history-ish" class, but it is a bit difficult to stay engaged. If you are behind on the readings, then you will be entirely lost. It's too reading dependent, there are only 2 assignments, I'd have more to push students to stay engaged.
Yes, if they are interested in religious studies

I would 100 percent recommend this course to another student. It gives you the opportunity to learn a lot about a truly fascinating subject in a low-stress and incredibly engaging environment. Definitely take a class with Professor Eire if you can!!
Definitely, interesting course work, great professoer
